message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes an automated method for extrinsic calibration between a camera and a 3D lidar, which is a common problem in robotics and autonomous systems. The method involves using a checkerboard as a reference and extracting features of interest in both sensor frames. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Robotics (cs.RO), Computer Vision (cs.CV), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The use of a genetic algorithm to address the highly non-linear state space suggests that the paper could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the application of the method to autonomous systems suggests that the paper could belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
